body_html:
Deadsnakes seems to have a number of caveats:

  1. They're on sufficiently new Python 3.7 that ssl doesn't compile correctly on trusty. Upstream issue: deadsnakes/issues#63 Most likely resolution is to move to xenial.
  2. They don't have Python 2.7.9. Probably OK to drop, IMO. (We should instead build against whatever distro ships it, if we are interested in supporting it.)
body_text:
Deadsnakes seems to have a number of caveats:

They're on sufficiently new Python 3.7 that ssl doesn't compile correctly on trusty. Upstream issue:  deadsnakes/issues#63 Most likely resolution is to move to xenial.
They don't have Python 2.7.9. Probably OK to drop, IMO. (We should instead build against whatever distro ships it, if we are interested in supporting it.)
body:
Deadsnakes seems to have a number of caveats:

1. They're on sufficiently new Python 3.7 that ssl doesn't compile correctly on trusty. Upstream issue:  https://github.com/deadsnakes/issues/issues/63 Most likely resolution is to move to xenial.
2. They don't have Python 2.7.9. Probably OK to drop, IMO. (We should instead build against whatever distro ships it, if we are interested in supporting it.)
